text: Hi <@UKGV272KS> you could test a list using the list filters in this screenshot to give you what you need.
<@UFBDBKQ1H> Thanks, but we need it to be a rolling 90 day period.
<@UKGV272KS> I wonder could you try something like this example to incorporate the 90 day rolling requirement. It involves two lists.
List 1: Segments all Contacts in the CRM that have receive 5 + emails over all time
List 2: Uses list 1 and adds the 90 day rolling filters:

<@UFBDBKQ1H> Thanks! This is close, but not quite there yet. The rolling 90 days might not be the very first 5 emails that someone received. They may have received emails prior to the previous 90 days, so we're looking for any 5+ emails. For more context, we're planning our re-engagement campaign that would go to subscribers that have not opened a marketing email in the past 90 days. However, some of our segments receive more emails than others, based on what is on sale for their segment and when. So, within that rolling 90 day period, some segments will have less opportunity to engage with us than other segments, so we wanted to put in a filter if possible that they received minimum 5 emails in that rolling 90 day period.
